intro: Stachys obliqua, commonly known as the narrow-leaved betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Stachys obliqua is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
